metadata.title: CVE-2021-47109 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:neighbour: allow NUD_NOARP entries to be forced GCed IFF_POINTOPOINTinterfaces use NUD_NOARP entries for IPv6. It's possible to fill up theneighbour table with enough entries that it will overflow for validconnections after that. This behaviour is more prevalent after commit58956317c8de ("neighbor: Improve garbage collection") is applied, as itprevents removal from entries that are not NUD_FAILED, unless they are morethan 5s old.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47109` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required
